instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight after waking up from sleep.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4v stable.
after sleeping for a while, board would not have backlight when i open the lid.
part problem has been ruled out as I put the board on my known good housing.

smc has been reballed.
<CHIP>U9701</CHIP> is replaced, with a5 jumper to pin 2 of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>
lvds has been replaced too.
any pointer ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no backlight after waking up from sleep.
threads.message:
You didn't specify if image is present.
What is the backlight output voltage at LCD connector in that moment?
